summary: This document is an email chain among federal prosecutors and law enforcement personnel discussing travel arrangements for a trip to Los Angeles in February 2020 to conduct interviews related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails focus on booking hotels within government per diem rates and coordinating logistics for meetings with attorneys.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.role: Detective, NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: He is coordinating travel logistics, confirming the booking of the Beverly Hilton at the government rate, and is part of the team traveling for interviews.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: She is copied on the email chain regarding travel approval and logistics for the Los Angeles trip.

persons.name: Darlene A. Alleyne
persons.context: She is the recipient of the travel approval request and is involved in the administrative process for authorizing the trip.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: He approves the travel request for the team to go to Los Angeles for interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: He submits the initial travel approval request for the team to travel to Los Angeles for interviews on specific dates in February 2020.

persons.name: Bjorlin
persons.role: Individual with an attorney in Los Angeles
persons.context: Mentioned as a person whose attorney's office in Los Angeles is a destination for the traveling team.

persons.name: Malyshev
persons.role: Individual with an attorney in Los Angeles
persons.context: Mentioned as a person whose attorney's office in Los Angeles is a destination for the traveling team.

persons.name: Kamilla
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the team possibly getting a conference room for her during the Los Angeles trip.

connections.description: Both are law enforcement personnel (NYPD/FBI Task Force and FBI) copied on the same travel coordination emails.
Both are with USANYS (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York); Tyrrell approves the travel request sent to Alleyne.
Alex submits a travel request to Tyrrell (and Alleyne) for approval, indicating a supervisory or administrative reporting relationship.
Both are individuals with attorneys in Los Angeles whom the prosecution team plans to visit, linking them contextually to the same investigation trip.

events.title: Scheduled Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The prosecution team has at least one interview scheduled in Los Angeles and plans to get a conference room for this date.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Epstein Investigation Interviews
events.description: A team from the U.S. Attorney's Office and law enforcement travels to Los Angeles to conduct multiple interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The travel is explicitly for the 'Epstein investigation' under case number 2018R01618, indicating active investigative work in February 2020.
The team is traveling to Los Angeles to conduct interviews with individuals connected to attorneys for Bjorlin and Malyshev, and potentially with Kamilla.
Logistical details reveal the team's focus on cost containment, using government per diem rates and selecting hotels based on proximity to interview locations.
The email chain shows coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys (Alex, Edward Tyrrell), administrative staff (Darlene Alleyne), and law enforcement (Paul Byrne, Amanda Young).
The document references a 'prior trip' and 'similar to prior requests,' indicating this is part of an ongoing series of investigative travels related to the Epstein case.
